column4: are NVIDIA drivers updated through the the ubuntu system update, or should i install the updates myself?
they are updated once in a while through sys update
ok, so how do i run this system update utility
very wierd...i wonder if it will survive a restart..will try it now..thx ed_debian
it will auto pop up with update and if you wantto run manually use this
ahh, i ran that, i will presume that the driver update hasnt been rolled out yet
im talking about official nvidia drivers btw
i preffer to wait for nvidia updates so i know its well tested :)
i think its a bug ed_debian, after the restart the panel dissappears..ill file a bug..thx again
yeah, well i prefer to wait cas it ruins the point of using distros again
if i installed it by hand
other then the obvious reasons of being open source, is there any good reason i should use the open source graphics driver for my graphics card
well thats the main reason :) if you want to get the best of the card unfortunanlty you have to use the closed source nvidia driver....lets hope some day thy will open their drivers..
sweet..im game ed_debian, where should we start?
lol..im a kde user on the desktop so hold on ill check :)
